description: Probably from Ancient Greek ἱστός (histós, “mast”) + -γραμμα (-gramma), although it is sometimes claimed to have been derived from historical + diagram; coined in 1891 by English mathematician Karl Pearson.

entries.meaning: (statistics) A graphical display of numerical data in the form of upright bars, with the area of each bar representing frequency.
examples: Such distinctions, however, require detailed information, such as histograms of the distribution of energy use among residential customers, both by month and by year.

verbs.description: histogram (third-person singular simple present histograms, present participle histogramming, simple past and past participle histogrammed)
